nfs4_op_readdir.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00097 #include "stuff_alloc.h"

00108 
00109 #define arg_READDIR4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opreaddir
00110 #define res_READDIR4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opreaddir
00111 
00112 extern time_t ServerBootTime ;
00113 
00126 int nfs4_op_readdir(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00127                       compound_data_t   * data,
00128                       struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00129 {
00130   cache_entry_t    * dir_pentry = NULL ;
00131   cache_entry_t    * pentry = NULL ;
00132   
00133   cache_inode_endofdir_t eod_met ;
00134   fsal_attrib_list_t     attr ;
00135   fsal_attrib_list_t     attrlookup ;
00136   cache_inode_status_t   cache_status ;
00137   cache_inode_status_t   cache_status_attr ;
00138   
00139   char               funcname[] = "nfs4_op_readdir" ;
00140     
00141   unsigned long              dircount;
00142   unsigned long              maxcount ;
00143   entry4 *                   entry_nfs_array ;
00144   cache_inode_dir_entry_t  * dirent_array;
00145   verifier4                  cookie_verifier;
00146   unsigned int               cookie ;
00147   unsigned int               end_cookie ;
00148   unsigned int             * cookie_array ;
00149   fsal_handle_t            * entry_FSALhandle ;
00150   nfs_fh4                    entryFH ;
00151 
00152   typedef char    entry_name_array_item_t[FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN] ;
00153   entry_name_array_item_t  * entry_name_array;
00154 
00155   unsigned long             space_used;
00156   unsigned int              estimated_num_entries;
00157   unsigned int              num_entries ;
00158 
00159   unsigned int              i = 0 ;
00160 
00161   bitmap4   RdAttrErrorBitmap ;
00162   attrlist4 RdAttrErrorVals   ;
00163     
00164   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_READDIR ;
00165   res_READDIR4.status =  NFS4_OK  ;
00166 
00167   entryFH.nfs_fh4_len = 0 ;
00168   
00169   /* If there is no FH */
00170   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->currentFH  ) ) )
00171     {
00172       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00173       return res_READDIR4.status ; 
00174     }
00175   
00176   /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00177   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->currentFH ) ) )
00178     {
00179       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00180       return res_READDIR4.status ;
00181     }
00182       
00183   /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00184   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00185     {
00186       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00187       return res_READDIR4.status ;
00188     }
00189   
00190   /* Pseudo Fs management */
00191   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Pseudo( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00192     return nfs4_op_readdir_pseudo( op, data, resp ) ;
00193   
00194   /* You can readdir only within a directory */
00195   dir_pentry = data->current_entry ;
00196   if ( data->current_filetype != DIR_BEGINNING && data->current_filetype != DIR_CONTINUE )
00197     {
00198       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_NOTDIR ;
00199       return res_READDIR4.status ;
00200     }
00201   
00202   /* get the caracteristic value for readdir operation */
00203   dircount = arg_READDIR4.dircount ;
00204   maxcount = arg_READDIR4.maxcount ;
00205   cookie   = (unsigned int)arg_READDIR4.cookie ; 
00206   space_used = sizeof( entry4 ) ;
00207 
00208   /* dircount is considered meaningless by many nfsv4 client (like the CITI one). we use maxcount instead */
00209   estimated_num_entries = maxcount / sizeof( entry4 )  ; /* Estimated_num_entries is probably far too big */
00210   
00211 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
00212   printf( "--- nfs4_op_readdir ---> dircount=%u maxcount=%u arg_cookie=%llu cookie=%d estimated_num_entries=%u\n", 
00213           dircount, maxcount, arg_READDIR4.cookie, cookie, estimated_num_entries ) ;
00214 #endif
00215   /* Do not use a cookie of 1 or 2 (reserved values) */
00216   if( cookie == 1 || cookie == 2 ) 
00217     {
00218       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_COOKIE ;
00219       return res_READDIR4.status ;
00220     }
00221  
00222   if( cookie != 0 ) cookie = cookie -2 ; /* 0,1 and 2 are reserved, there is a delta of '3' because of this */
00223    
00224    /* Get only attributes that are allowed to be read */
00225   if( !nfs4_Fattr_Check_Access_Bitmap( &arg_READDIR4.attr_request, FATTR4_ATTR_READ ) )
00226     {
00227       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00228       return res_READDIR4.status ;
00229     }
00230  
00231 
00232   /* If maxcount is too short, return NFS4ERR_TOOSMALL */
00233   if( maxcount < sizeof( entry4 ) || estimated_num_entries == 0  )
00234     {
00235       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_TOOSMALL ;
00236       return res_READDIR4.status ;
00237     }
00238   
00239   /*
00240    * If cookie verifier is used, then an non-trivial value is
00241    * returned to the client         This value is the mtime of
00242    * the pentry. If verifier is unused (as in many NFS
00243    * Servers) then only a set of zeros is returned (trivial
00244    * value) 
00245    */
00246   memset(cookie_verifier, 0, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE ) ;
00247   if( data->pexport->UseCookieVerifier == 1 )
00248       memcpy(cookie_verifier, &dir_pentry->internal_md.mod_time, sizeof( time_t ) ) ;
00249       
00250   /* Cookie delivered by the server and used by the client SHOULD not ne 0, 1 or 2 (cf RFC3530, page192)
00251    * because theses value are reserved for special use.
00252    *      0 - cookie for first READDIR
00253    *      1 - reserved for . on client handside
00254    *      2 - reserved for .. on client handside
00255    * Entries '.' and '..' are not returned also
00256    * For these reason, there will be an offset of 3 between NFS4 cookie and HPSS cookie */
00257   
00258   if( ( cookie !=0  ) && ( data->pexport->UseCookieVerifier == 1 ) )
00259     {
00260       if(  memcmp(cookie_verifier, arg_READDIR4.cookieverf, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE  ) != 0 )
00261         {
00262           
00263           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_COOKIE ;
00264           return  res_READDIR4.status ;
00265         }
00266     }
00267 
00268   /* The default behaviour is to consider that eof is not reached, the returned values by cache_inode_readdir 
00269    * will let us know if eod was reached or not */
00270   res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.eof = FALSE ;
00271   
00272   /* Get prepared for readdir */
00273   if( ( dirent_array = (cache_inode_dir_entry_t *)Mem_Alloc(estimated_num_entries * sizeof( cache_inode_dir_entry_t ) ) ) == NULL )
00274     {
00275       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00276       return res_READDIR4.status;
00277     }
00278   
00279   if( ( cookie_array = (unsigned int *)Mem_Alloc( estimated_num_entries * sizeof( unsigned int ) ) ) == NULL )
00280     {
00281       Mem_Free( (char *)dirent_array ) ;
00282 
00283       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00284       return res_READDIR4.status;
00285     }
00286 
00287   /* Perform the readdir operation */
00288   if( cache_inode_readdir(dir_pentry, 
00289                           cookie,
00290                           estimated_num_entries, 
00291                           &num_entries, 
00292                           &end_cookie,
00293                           &eod_met,
00294                           dirent_array, 
00295                           cookie_array,
00296                           data->ht, 
00297                           data->pclient,
00298                           data->pcontext, 
00299                           &cache_status) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00300     {
00301       res_READDIR4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00302       return res_READDIR4.status;
00303     }
00304   
00305   if( eod_met == END_OF_DIR )
00306     {
00307       /* This is the end of the directory */
00308       res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.eof = TRUE ;
00309       memcpy( res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.cookieverf, cookie_verifier, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE ) ;
00310     }
00311   
00312     
00313 
00314   /* For an empty directory, we will find only . and .., so reply af if the end if reached */
00315   if( num_entries == 0 )
00316     {
00317       /* only . and .. */
00318       res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries = NULL ;
00319       res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.eof = TRUE ;
00320       memcpy( res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.cookieverf, cookie_verifier, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE ) ;
00321     }
00322   else
00323     {
00324   
00325       /* Allocation of reply structures */
00326       if( ( entry_name_array = (entry_name_array_item_t *)Mem_Alloc(num_entries * (FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN + 1) ) ) == NULL )
00327         {
00328           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00329           return res_READDIR4.status;
00330         }
00331       memset( (char *)entry_name_array, 0, num_entries * (FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN + 1) ) ;
00332             
00333       if( ( entry_nfs_array = (entry4 *)Mem_Alloc(num_entries * sizeof( entry4 ) ) ) == NULL )
00334         {
00335           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00336           return res_READDIR4.status;
00337         }
00338 
00339       for( i = 0 ; i < num_entries ; i ++ )
00340         {
00341           entry_nfs_array[i].name.utf8string_val =  entry_name_array[i] ;
00342           
00343           if( str2utf8( dirent_array[i].name.name, &entry_nfs_array[i].name ) == -1 )
00344             {
00345               res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00346               return res_READDIR4.status;
00347             }
00348           
00349           /* Set the cookie value */
00350           if( i != num_entries -1 )
00351             entry_nfs_array[i].cookie = cookie_array[i+1] + 2 ; /* 0, 1 and 2 are reserved */
00352           else
00353             entry_nfs_array[i].cookie = end_cookie + 2 ;
00354 
00355 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
00356           printf( " === nfs4_op_readdir ===>   i=%d name=%s cookie=%llu\n", 
00357                   i, dirent_array[i].name.name, entry_nfs_array[i].cookie ) ;
00358 #endif
00359 
00360           if( ( pentry = cache_inode_lookup( dir_pentry, 
00361                                              &dirent_array[i].name,
00362                                              &attrlookup,
00363                                              data->ht, 
00364                                              data->pclient, 
00365                                              data->pcontext,
00366                                              &cache_status ) ) == NULL )
00367             {
00368               Mem_Free( (char *)entry_nfs_array ) ;
00369               Mem_Free( (char *)dirent_array ) ;
00370               Mem_Free( (char *)cookie_array ) ;
00371               /* Return the fattr4_rdattr_error , cf RFC3530, page 192 */
00372               entry_nfs_array[i].attrs.attrmask  = RdAttrErrorBitmap ;
00373               entry_nfs_array[i].attrs.attr_vals = RdAttrErrorVals ;
00374               res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00375               return res_READDIR4.status;
00376             }
00377 
00378            /* If file handle is asked in the attributes, provide it */
00379           if( arg_READDIR4.attr_request.bitmap4_val != NULL && (arg_READDIR4.attr_request.bitmap4_val[0] & FATTR4_FILEHANDLE) )
00380             {
00381              if( ( entry_FSALhandle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( pentry, &cache_status_attr ) ) == NULL )
00382                {
00383                  /* Faulty Handle or pentry */
00384                   Mem_Free( (char *)entry_nfs_array ) ;
00385                   Mem_Free( (char *)dirent_array ) ;
00386                   Mem_Free( (char *)cookie_array ) ;
00387                   res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00388                   return res_READDIR4.status;
00389                 }
00390 
00391              if( entryFH.nfs_fh4_len == 0 )
00392                {
00393                  if( nfs4_AllocateFH( &entryFH ) != NFS4_OK )
00394                    {
00395                      Mem_Free( (char *)entry_nfs_array ) ;
00396                      Mem_Free( (char *)dirent_array ) ;
00397                      Mem_Free( (char *)cookie_array ) ;
00398                      res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00399                      return res_READDIR4.status;
00400                    }
00401                }
00402              
00403              if( !nfs4_FSALToFhandle( &entryFH, entry_FSALhandle, data ) )
00404                 {
00405                   /* Faulty type */
00406                   Mem_Free( (char *)entry_nfs_array ) ;
00407                   Mem_Free( (char *)dirent_array ) ;
00408                   Mem_Free( (char *)cookie_array ) ;
00409                   res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00410                   return res_READDIR4.status;
00411                 }
00412             }
00413           
00414           if( nfs4_FSALattr_To_Fattr( data->pexport,
00415                                       &attrlookup, 
00416                                       &(entry_nfs_array[i].attrs), 
00417                                       data,
00418                                       &entryFH,
00419                                       &(arg_READDIR4.attr_request) ) != 0 )
00420             {
00421               /* Return the fattr4_rdattr_error , cf RFC3530, page 192 */
00422               entry_nfs_array[i].attrs.attrmask  = RdAttrErrorBitmap ;
00423               entry_nfs_array[i].attrs.attr_vals = RdAttrErrorVals ;
00424             } 
00425 
00426           /* Chain the entries together */ 
00427           entry_nfs_array[i].nextentry = NULL;
00428           if( i != 0 ) 
00429             entry_nfs_array[i-1].nextentry = &(entry_nfs_array[i]); 
00430 
00431           /* This test is there to avoid going further than the buffer provided by the client 
00432            * the factor "9/10" is there for safety. Its value could be change as beta tests will be done */
00433           if( (caddr_t)((caddr_t)(&entry_nfs_array[i]) - (caddr_t)(&entry_nfs_array[0])) > (caddr_t)(maxcount*9/10) )
00434              break ;
00435         } /* for i */
00436 
00437       
00438       /* Put the entry's list in the READDIR reply */
00439       res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries = entry_nfs_array ;
00440     }    
00441   
00442   /* Do not forget to set the verifier */
00443   memcpy( (char *)res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.cookieverf, cookie_verifier, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE ) ;
00444 
00445   Mem_Free( (char *)dirent_array ) ;
00446   Mem_Free( (char *)cookie_array ) ;
00447   res_READDIR4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00448   
00449   return res_READDIR4.status;
00450 } /* nfs4_op_readdir */
00451 
00452     
00463 void nfs4_op_readdir_Free( READDIR4res * resp )
00464 {
00465   entry4 * entries ;
00466   
00467   if( resp->status == NFS4_OK )
00468     {
00469       for( entries = resp->READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries; entries != NULL ; entries = entries->nextentry )
00470         {
00471           Mem_Free( (char *)entries->name.utf8string_val ) ;
00472           Mem_Free( (char *)entries->attrs.attrmask.bitmap4_val ) ;
00473           Mem_Free( (char *)entries->attrs.attr_vals.attrlist4_val ) ;
00474         }
00475       Mem_Free( (char *)resp->READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries ) ;
00476     }
00477   
00478   return ;
00479 } /* nfs4_op_readdir_Free */
Generated on Wed Apr 9 08:24:28 2008 for NFS and Mount protocols layer by  1.3.9.1
